p: To analyze how forest composition was influenced by the 12 N deposition–climate scenarios, we estimated total tree biomass and distribution across species in 2100 for each scenario (Fig. 6). The starting basal area (i.e., in 2005) of the FIA plots within the study area ranged from 4.5–40 m 2/ha (5th–95th percentile) and averaged 22 m 2/ha, which indicates a relatively young, immature forest condition. Compared to 2005, total aboveground biomass increased by between 9.7 Pg and 16.1 Pg (a factor of between 2.5 and 3.5) across scenarios.
